com.amplifyframework.datastore

Class AmplifyDisposables

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amplifyframework.datastore.AmplifyDisposables

  • public final class AmplifyDisposables
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility for building Rx Disposables from Amplify entities, e.g. the Cancelable.

      • onErrorConsumerWrapperFor

        public static <T extends Model,E extends AmplifyException> Consumer<E> onErrorConsumerWrapperFor(<any> realEmitter)
        This function that creates a Consumer which wraps the ObservableEmitter#onError(Throwable) to prevent it from calling observers that have already been disposed.

        The scenario is that we have multiple event sources (1 AppSync subscription for each model+operation type combination) being consumed by a single downstream oberserver. Once the first subscription emits an error, the downstream subscriber is placed in a disposed state and will not receive any further notifications. In a situation such as loss of connectivity, it's innevitable that multiple subscriptions will fail. With that said, after the first failure, the other events sources (AppSync subscriptions) will attempt to invoke the downstream onError handler which then results in an io.reactivex.rxjava3.exceptions.UndeliverableException being thrown.

        This method takes a reference of the observable that represents the AppSync subscription, wraps it and returns a Consumer that is used as the onError parameter. The returned Consumer function will delegate the onError call to the downstream observers if it's still available, otherwise it logs a warning.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of model handled by the emitter.
        E - The type of exception for the onError consumer
        Parameters:
        realEmitter - The emitter which will have it's onError function proxied by the return value of this function.
        Returns:
        A Consumer that proxies the ObservableEmitter#onError(Throwable) call to the realEmitter if it's not disposed or logs a warning.
        See Also:
        GitHub issue #541
